poem:
**Echoes of Trust**

Ink and paper gasp,  
250,000 voices fade  
into the ether, silent—  
a trust unthreaded,  
tethering on conviction's edge.  
Bezos stands, undeterred,  
whispering to shadows  
in dim-lit corridors.  
With trust's fragile seed scattered,  
the broadsheet's tale unravels.  
Words weave,  
unbinding.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
